content: of the fpdtr2tog around the third double_crochet of the chain space of round 2 work the second leg of the fpdtr2tog around the second double_crochet of the next chain space of round 2 see image below skip the stitch behind the fpdtr2tog and single_crochet in following 5 stitches single_crochet ch2 into chain space* repeat *-* three more times join with slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet of round 4 fasten_off 12sc and 1fpdtrtog/side work the first leg of work the secon d leg of the fpdtr2tog around the fpdtr2tog around this double_crochet of round 2 this double_crochet of round 2 3 round 5 change to color a start in any corner chain space of round 4 chain 3 or work a standing double_crochet in the chain space double_crochet into same chain space *double_crochet in next 13 stitches note the corner might be rather tight be careful not to miss the hidden stitch work 2dc ch2 2dc in chain space* repeat * to * two more times double_crochet in next 13 stitches 2 double_crochet in chain space chain 2 and join with slip_stitch to 3rd chain of first ch3 fasten_off 17dc/side hidden stitch round 6 in this round you will work the drop-down stitch work the treble stitch by inserting your hook under the fpdtr2tog and through the front loop see image this creates a neat stitch and gives the fpdtr2tog a little tug bringing it closer to the border change to color b start in any chain space corner *work single_crochet in chain space single_crochet in next 8 stitches treble_crochet into fpdtr2tog of round 4 skip next stitch the one behind the treble_crochet single_crochet in following 8 stitches single_crochet ch2 into chain space* repeat * to * three times join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet of round 6 fasten_off 18dc and 1tr/side skip next stitch and work treble_crochet under the fpdtr2tog of round 4 4 alternative drop-down stitches depending on your yarn your gauge and your desired effect you might prefer to work a half_double_crochet or a double_crochet as the drop-down stitch if you choose the double_crochet as your drop-down stitch work only into the front loop of the fpdtr2tog of row 4 see image below this creates a more crisp diamond shape and works well with stiff yarns if you are using a springy yarn i find it s better to work a treble_crochet under the stitch your northern diamond square is now complete fasten_off and weave in the ends or go on to the extended version on the next page these squares were made using scheepjes stonewashed and a 4 mm hook for the square on the right round 5 was worked in the back loop
